<FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. Bless the LORD, O my soul: and all that is within me, <FI>bless<Fi> his holy name.
Bless the LORD, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
Who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
Who satisfieth thy mouth with good <FI>things; so that<Fi> thy youth is renewed like the eagle's.<CM>
The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
He made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.<RF>plentious…: Heb. great in mercy<Rf>
He will not always chide: neither will he keep <FI>his anger<Fi> for ever.
He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
For as the heaven is high above the earth, <FI>so<Fi> great is his mercy toward them that fear him.<RF>as…: Heb. according to the height of the heaven<Rf>
As far as the east is from the west, <FI>so<Fi> far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
Like as a father pitieth <FI>his<Fi> children, <FI>so<Fi> the LORD pitieth them that fear him.
For he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we <FI>are<Fi> dust.
<FI>As for<Fi> man, his days <FI>are<Fi> as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
For the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.<RF>it is…: Heb. it is not<Rf>
But the mercy of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children's children;
To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.<CM>
The LORD hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.
Bless the LORD, ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.<RF>that excel…: Heb. mighty in strength<Rf>
Bless ye the LORD, all <FI>ye<Fi> his hosts; <FI>ye<Fi> ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
Bless the LORD, all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the LORD, O my soul.<CM>
